db:info.db:title: Getting Started with Qt for Android

db:link.xlink:title: Qt for Android - Building from Source

db:abstract.db:para: Provides instructions to install and configure your development environment.

db:section.db:title: Installing Qt for Android with Qt Installer
db:section.db:para: See Get and Install Qt and select Qt for Android in the installer.

db:section.db:title: Manually Installing the Prerequisites
db:section.db:para: In order to use Qt for Android, you need the following:

db:listitem.db:para: Java Development Kit 11 (JDK) or above provided by AdoptOpenJDK for all platforms, is required to build Android apps. Other alternatives such as OpenJDK for Linux and macOS or Java SE Development Kit for Windows are also supported.
Gradle 7.2 for building application packages (APK) and app bundles (AAB) for Android devices. Gradle is delivered with Qt.
The Android Command-line SDK Tools to install the following packages that are required to compile Qt applications for Android:
The Android NDK, which contains toolchains and debuggers for Android.

db:note.db:para: Qt Creator 4.12 or later can set up the SDK Tools, NDK, and essential packages automatically. For more information, see Qt Creator: Specifying Android Device Settings.
If you are using the SDK Tools 26.x or below, the JDK 8 is required. Versions higher than 8 might cause issues for the Android SDK tools.

db:listitem.db:para: The Android NDK can be installed using the sdkmanager tool. Alternatively, you can download it and extract it manually to a path of your choosing.

db:td.db:para: Android 6.0 or later (API level 23 or higher)
Clang 11.0.5 (NDK r22b) as provided by Google, MinGW 11.2

db:note.db:para: Make sure to unpack the Android SDK and NDK to a writable location that Qt Creator can access later. Otherwise, Qt Creator won't be able to use sdkmanager or find all components even if they were installed manually.

db:section.db:title: Qt Creator IDE
db:section.db:para: The Qt Creator IDE can be used to develop Qt applications for Android. For more information, see Qt Creator: Connecting Android Devices.

db:section.db:title: Testing Your Setup
db:section.db:para: Now you can test your development setup by running the examples shipped with the Qt installation. For more information, see Qt for Android Examples.
To develop a simple application from scratch, see Qt Creator: Creating a Mobile Application.
